elements.content: Presented here is an interpenetrated three-dimensional copper–iodine cluster-based framework with dia topology based on two different kinds of Cu4I4 subunits that is templated by an enantiopure porphyrin-like CuI(5-eatz)2 unit and shows excellent photocatalytic activity to degrade methylene blue under visible light.
elements.clean_text: Presented here is an interpenetrated three-dimensional copper-iodine cluster-based framework with dia topology based on two different kinds of Cu4I4 subunits that is templated by an enantiopure porphyrin-like CuI(5-eatz)2 unit and shows excellent photocatalytic activity to degrade methylene blue under visible light.

elements.content: An interpenetrated three-dimensional copper−iodine cluster-based framework, which was templated by an enantiopure porphyrin-like metal−organic unit, was synthesized. It is constructed by two kinds of Cu4I4 subunits, shows dia topology, and presents excellent photocatalytic activity to degrade methylene blue under visible light.
elements.clean_text: An interpenetrated three-dimensional copper-iodine cluster-based framework, which was templated by an enantiopure porphyrin-like metal-organic unit, was synthesized. It is constructed by two kinds of Cu4I4 subunits, shows dia topology, and presents excellent photocatalytic activity to degrade methylene blue under visible light.

elements.content: Zeolites, as an important class of inorganic crystalline microporous materials containing TO4 (T = Si, Al, P, Ge) tetrahedral units, are of current interest for their applications in the petroleum refining and fine chemical industries. However, because of the inherent insulating characteristic of oxide-based zeolites, their applications in photocatalytic/electric-related processes were greatly limited. To broaden their performances in targeted applications and create multifunctional zeolitic materials, there is a high demand for new multinuclear building units.
elements.clean_text: Zeolites, as an important class of inorganic crystalline microporous materials containing TO4 (T = Si, Al, P, Ge) tetrahedral units, are of current interest for their applications in the petroleum refining and fine chemical industries. However, because of the inherent insulating characteristic of oxide-based zeolites, their applications in photocatalytic/electric-related processes were greatly limited. To broaden their performances in targeted applications and create multifunctional zeolitic materials, there is a high demand for new multinuclear building units.

elements.content: It has been reported that chalcogenide clusters can serve as pseudotetrahedral units to form zeotype structures. In comparison, metal halide clusters, especially copper iodides, display polarizabilities comparable to those of chalcogenides, making them also suitable to serve as tetrahedral units of zeotype frameworks. However, because of the multiple forms and structural diversities of metal iodides, it still remains a great challenge to prepare metal iodide cluster-based zeolitic materials.
elements.clean_text: It has been reported that chalcogenide clusters can serve as pseudotetrahedral units to form zeotype structures. In comparison, metal halide clusters, especially copper iodides, display polarizabilities comparable to those of chalcogenides, making them also suitable to serve as tetrahedral units of zeotype frameworks. However, because of the multiple forms and structural diversities of metal iodides, it still remains a great challenge to prepare metal iodide cluster-based zeolitic materials.

elements.content: Herein we report an interpenetrated three-dimensional (3D) copper–iodine cluster-based framework, [N­(CH3)4)]2 2+[Cu14I12(5-eatz)4]2− [1; 5-eatz = (1R)-1-(5-tetrazolyl)­ethylamine], based on two kinds of Cu4I4 subunits (secondary building units, SBUs), a cubane and an eight-membered ring, which exhibits 2-fold-interpenetrated dia topology and is templated by an enantiopure porphyrin-like CuI(5-eatz)2 unit. Furthermore, such a 2-fold-interpenetrated copper–iodine clusters were linked by the Cu-5-eatz units, giving rise to a zeolitic framework with 4,4-connected (64.82)2(66) topology. Furthermore, this copper–iodine cluster-based framework shows excellent photocatalytic activity to degrade methylene blue (MB) under visible light because of its narrow band gap of 1.49 eV.
elements.clean_text: Herein we report an interpenetrated three-dimensional (3D) copper-iodine cluster-based framework, [N(CH3)4)]2 2+[Cu14I12(5-eatz)4]2- [1; 5-eatz = (1R)-1-(5-tetrazolyl)ethylamine], based on two kinds of Cu4I4 subunits (secondary building units, SBUs), a cubane and an eight-membered ring, which exhibits 2-fold-interpenetrated dia topology and is templated by an enantiopure porphyrin-like CuI(5-eatz)2 unit. Furthermore, such a 2-fold-interpenetrated copper-iodine clusters were linked by the Cu-5-eatz units, giving rise to a zeolitic framework with 4,4-connected (64.82)2(66) topology. Furthermore, this copper-iodine cluster-based framework shows excellent photocatalytic activity to degrade methylene blue (MB) under visible light because of its narrow band gap of 1.49 eV.

elements.content: The orange crystal of 1 was prepared by the reaction of 5-eatz, N­(CH3)4Br, CuI, and KI under hydrothermal conditions. The structure and composition of 1 were characterized by single-crystal X-ray diffraction (XRD) and elemental analysis, and its phase purity and thermal stability were identified by powder XRD (PXRD) and thermogravimetric analysis (TGA), respectively (Supporting Information). Single-crystal XRD revealed that 1 crystallizes in tetragonal symmetry with space group P42 and contains eight copper atoms, six iodine atoms, two 5-eatz ligands, and [N­(CH3)4]+ ions (Figure S3).
elements.clean_text: The orange crystal of 1 was prepared by the reaction of 5-eatz, N(CH3)4Br, CuI, and KI under hydrothermal conditions. The structure and composition of 1 were characterized by single-crystal X-ray diffraction (XRD) and elemental analysis, and its phase purity and thermal stability were identified by powder XRD (PXRD) and thermogravimetric analysis (TGA), respectively (Supporting Information). Single-crystal XRD revealed that 1 crystallizes in tetragonal symmetry with space group P42 and contains eight copper atoms, six iodine atoms, two 5-eatz ligands, and [N(CH3)4]+ ions (Figure S3).

elements.content: The prominent structural feature of 1 is that it has an interpenetrated 3D copper–iodine cluster based on two types of Cu4I4 SBUs generated in situ from CuI. The first one is the common tetrahedral Cu4I4 cubane (a). Each Cu4I4 cubane in 1 consists of four tetrahedrally coordinated Cu+ ions bonded by four μ3-I– anions. The relatively short Cu···Cu distances ranging from 2.549 to 2.825 Å are comparable or even less than twice the van der Waals radius (1.4 Å) of CuI, implying strong Cu–Cu interaction. The second one is an unusual Cu4I4 subunit with an eight-membered ring (b). Notably, it shows an interesting configuration: four copper and two iodine atoms are coplanar, and the other two I– ions locate oppositely along the plane. The Cu···Cu distances of the eight-membered ring range from 2.879 to 3.443 Å, which are longer than that of a Cu4I4 cubane. It should be noted that the coexistence of two such different Cu4I4 SBUs in one compound has never been observed previously. Each Cu4I4 cubane serves as a tetrahedral node, which was linked by four Cu4I4 eight-membered rings, while each Cu4I4 eight-membered ring, acting as linkers, uses its two edges to connect two Cu4I4 cubane tetramers. Both Cu4I4 SBUs link each other to form 2-fold-interpenetrated 3D clusters (d), which can be simplified into a dia net (e). A typical dia cage substructure, including 10 Cu4I4 cubanes and 12 Cu4I4 eight-membered rings, is presented (c).
elements.clean_text: The prominent structural feature of 1 is that it has an interpenetrated 3D copper-iodine cluster based on two types of Cu4I4 SBUs generated in situ from CuI. The first one is the common tetrahedral Cu4I4 cubane (a). Each Cu4I4 cubane in 1 consists of four tetrahedrally coordinated Cu+ ions bonded by four μ3-I- anions. The relatively short Cu⋅⋅⋅Cu distances ranging from 2.549 to 2.825 Å are comparable or even less than twice the van der Waals radius (1.4 Å) of CuI, implying strong Cu-Cu interaction. The second one is an unusual Cu4I4 subunit with an eight-membered ring (b). Notably, it shows an interesting configuration: four copper and two iodine atoms are coplanar, and the other two I- ions locate oppositely along the plane. The Cu⋅⋅⋅Cu distances of the eight-membered ring range from 2.879 to 3.443 Å, which are longer than that of a Cu4I4 cubane. It should be noted that the coexistence of two such different Cu4I4 SBUs in one compound has never been observed previously. Each Cu4I4 cubane serves as a tetrahedral node, which was linked by four Cu4I4 eight-membered rings, while each Cu4I4 eight-membered ring, acting as linkers, uses its two edges to connect two Cu4I4 cubane tetramers. Both Cu4I4 SBUs link each other to form 2-fold-interpenetrated 3D clusters (d), which can be simplified into a dia net (e). A typical dia cage substructure, including 10 Cu4I4 cubanes and 12 Cu4I4 eight-membered rings, is presented (c).

elements.content: (a) Cu4I4 cubane. (b) Cu4I4 eight-membered ring. (c) dia topology cage. (d) 3D copper–iodine clusters with 2-fold interpenetration. (e) dia topology of the copper­(I)–iodine clusters.
elements.clean_text: 1  (a) Cu4I4 cubane. (b) Cu4I4 eight-membered ring. (c) dia topology cage. (d) 3D copper-iodine clusters with 2-fold interpenetration. (e) dia topology of the copper(I)-iodine clusters.

elements.content: Another extraordinary feature of 1 is the presence of derivation from 4-connected dia topology to 4,4-connected topology. Besides the above-mentioned two Cu4I4 clusters, another interesting unit, denoted by CuI(5-eatz)2, is also observed in 1 (a). Such an enantiopure porphyrin-like unit is formed by two homochiral 5-eatz ligands chelating one CuI. There are strong hydrogen-bonding interactions between them. Moreover, CuI(5-eatz)2 only located between two Cu4I4 eight-membered-ring SBUs, which linked the 2-fold-interpenetrated 3D clusters (c) into one and further stabilized the framework (d). The attendance of the CuI(5-eatz)2 unit also brings a new node, the planar four-connected (Cu4I4 eight-membered ring) node, for the whole framework topology. The whole framework of 1 can be topologically represented as a 4,4-connected net with a point symbol of (64.82)2(66). Interestingly, the introduction of the planar 4-connected node generates an unusual cage structure, including six Cu4I4 cubanes, 12 Cu4I4 eight-membered rings, and eight CuI(5-eatz)2 units (c) with the symbol of 68, which has never been observed in both zeolite and zeolitic imidazolate frameworks before. The [N­(CH3)4]+ cations just fill in the center of the cage.
elements.clean_text: Another extraordinary feature of 1 is the presence of derivation from 4-connected dia topology to 4,4-connected topology. Besides the above-mentioned two Cu4I4 clusters, another interesting unit, denoted by CuI(5-eatz)2, is also observed in 1 (a). Such an enantiopure porphyrin-like unit is formed by two homochiral 5-eatz ligands chelating one CuI. There are strong hydrogen-bonding interactions between them. Moreover, CuI(5-eatz)2 only located between two Cu4I4 eight-membered-ring SBUs, which linked the 2-fold-interpenetrated 3D clusters (c) into one and further stabilized the framework (d). The attendance of the CuI(5-eatz)2 unit also brings a new node, the planar four-connected (Cu4I4 eight-membered ring) node, for the whole framework topology. The whole framework of 1 can be topologically represented as a 4,4-connected net with a point symbol of (64.82)2(66). Interestingly, the introduction of the planar 4-connected node generates an unusual cage structure, including six Cu4I4 cubanes, 12 Cu4I4 eight-membered rings, and eight CuI(5-eatz)2 units (c) with the symbol of 68, which has never been observed in both zeolite and zeolitic imidazolate frameworks before. The [N(CH3)4]+ cations just fill in the center of the cage.

elements.content: (a) Strong hydrogen-bonding interactions between enantiopure porphyrin-like templates consisting of CuI and 5-eatz. The hydrogen atoms were omitted for clarity. (b) Whole framework of 1. (c) 2-fold-interpenetrated dia nets of the 3D copper–iodine clusters. (d) Whole topology of 1.
elements.clean_text: 2  (a) Strong hydrogen-bonding interactions between enantiopure porphyrin-like templates consisting of CuI and 5-eatz. The hydrogen atoms were omitted for clarity. (b) Whole framework of 1. (c) 2-fold-interpenetrated dia nets of the 3D copper-iodine clusters. (d) Whole topology of 1.

elements.content: (a) dia cages interpenetrating each other. (b) CuI(5-eatz)2 units linking adjacent dia cages to form another kind of small cage. (c) Magnification of the cage and relative tile. (d) 68 topology with the [N­(CH3)4]+ ion located in the center of it. There are no obvious interactions between the [N­(CH3)4]+ ion and the framework.
elements.clean_text: 3  (a) dia cages interpenetrating each other. (b) CuI(5-eatz)2 units linking adjacent dia cages to form another kind of small cage. (c) Magnification of the cage and relative tile. (d) 68 topology with the [N(CH3)4]+ ion located in the center of it. There are no obvious interactions between the [N(CH3)4]+ ion and the framework.

elements.content: It should be noted that only a few examples of 3D copper­(I) halide clusters have been reported before. Among them, just two compounds are based on copper–iodine clusters. The compound reported here is the first one with 3D copper–iodine clusters based on two different copper–iodine clusters. The main reason may be that the in situ captured enantiopure porphyrin-like CuI(5-eatz)2 units act as effective templates. In the synthesis of inorganic zeolites as well as metal halide clusters, organic amines are widely applied as structure-directing agents (SDAs). However, metal–organic templates such as the SDAs reported here have never been observed before.
elements.clean_text: It should be noted that only a few examples of 3D copper(I) halide clusters have been reported before. Among them, just two compounds are based on copper-iodine clusters. The compound reported here is the first one with 3D copper-iodine clusters based on two different copper-iodine clusters. The main reason may be that the in situ captured enantiopure porphyrin-like CuI(5-eatz)2 units act as effective templates. In the synthesis of inorganic zeolites as well as metal halide clusters, organic amines are widely applied as structure-directing agents (SDAs). However, metal-organic templates such as the SDAs reported here have never been observed before.

elements.content: The band gap of 1 was investigated by a UV–vis diffuse-reflectance measurement method at room temperature (a). According to the equation αhν2 = K(hν – E g)1/2 (where α is the absorption coefficient, hν is the discrete photo energy, K is a constant, and E g is the band-gap energy), the extrapolated values (the straight lines to the x axis) of hν at α = 0 give absorption edge energies corresponding to E g = 1.49 eV for 1. It has an absorption response to visible light due to its narrow-band-gap size. This result is also consistent with the color of their crystals, with yellow for 1 (a).
elements.clean_text: The band gap of 1 was investigated by a UV-vis diffuse-reflectance measurement method at room temperature (a). According to the equation αhν2 = K(hν - E g)1/2 (where α is the absorption coefficient, hν is the discrete photo energy, K is a constant, and E g is the band-gap energy), the extrapolated values (the straight lines to the x axis) of hν at α = 0 give absorption edge energies corresponding to E g = 1.49 eV for 1. It has an absorption response to visible light due to its narrow-band-gap size. This result is also consistent with the color of their crystals, with yellow for 1 (a).

elements.content: (a and b) Solid-state UV–vis reflectance spectra of crystal 1. (c) Temporal UV–vis absorption spectral changes of MB aqueous solutions with photodegradation catalyzed by 1 in the presence of a H2O2 additive. (d) Photodegradation rates of 1 (red), H2O2 (black), and 1 in the presence of a H2O2 additive (blue).
elements.clean_text: 4  (a and b) Solid-state UV-vis reflectance spectra of crystal 1. (c) Temporal UV-vis absorption spectral changes of MB aqueous solutions with photodegradation catalyzed by 1 in the presence of a H2O2 additive. (d) Photodegradation rates of 1 (red), H2O2 (black), and 1 in the presence of a H2O2 additive (blue).

elements.content: The photocatalytic activities of 1 were evaluated for MB photodegradation under visible-light illumination. The characteristic absorption of MB at about 665 nm was selected for monitoring the adsorption and photocatalytic degradation process. The photocatalytic activity of 1 was gradually enhanced with time increasing from 0 to 25 min, which demonstrated that 1 has a much higher activity (). After 25 min, MB in the solution almost disappeared when using 1 as the photocatalyst. Moreover, 1 is stable under repeated application with a nearly constant photocatalytic degradation rate (Figures S4b and S6). These results show that 1 is an excellent photocatalyst under visible light.
elements.clean_text: The photocatalytic activities of 1 were evaluated for MB photodegradation under visible-light illumination. The characteristic absorption of MB at about 665 nm was selected for monitoring the adsorption and photocatalytic degradation process. The photocatalytic activity of 1 was gradually enhanced with time increasing from 0 to 25 min, which demonstrated that 1 has a much higher activity (). After 25 min, MB in the solution almost disappeared when using 1 as the photocatalyst. Moreover, 1 is stable under repeated application with a nearly constant photocatalytic degradation rate (Figures S4b and S6). These results show that 1 is an excellent photocatalyst under visible light.

elements.content: In summary, we report an interpenetrated 3D copper–iodine cluster-based framework, based on two kinds of Cu4I4 subunits (SBUs), a cubane and an eight-membered ring. It exhibits 2-fold-interpenetrated dia topology and is templated by an enantiopure porphyrin-like CuI(5-eatz)2 unit. Furthermore, this zeolitic framework exhibits outstanding photocatalytic activity under visible light.
elements.clean_text: In summary, we report an interpenetrated 3D copper-iodine cluster-based framework, based on two kinds of Cu4I4 subunits (SBUs), a cubane and an eight-membered ring. It exhibits 2-fold-interpenetrated dia topology and is templated by an enantiopure porphyrin-like CuI(5-eatz)2 unit. Furthermore, this zeolitic framework exhibits outstanding photocatalytic activity under visible light.

metadata.title:
Interpenetrated
Three-Dimensional Copper–Iodine Cluster-Based Framework with
Enantiopure Porphyrin-like Templates
